page.title: 16DURRINGTON-CONFLICTING VIEWS
page.content: Mrs Osborne,resident of Durrington, says that at present she likes her area as it is a suburb of Worthing, close to Arundel and the West.However she dislikes the mushrooming developments of small box-type houses, lack of access roads and increasing traffic load.Insufficient shops, except Tesco's supermarket, leads to overcrowded pavements and enforced queues in this area of housing explosion. Four residents of Durrington were questioned.Three had moved to the area in the last two years but one did so 40 years ago.The people liked the quietness and the convenience of shops.The noisy roads were the only thing disliked.The only changes noticed were the buildings.Their overall impresion was that of a quiet, pleasant residential area.
